website_summaries.verdict: A loud and powerful dual purpose cymbal, doubling up as a ride as well as a crash, making this a highly versatile cymbal at an excellent value for those on a budget.
pros: Crafted from brass with high-pressure hammering and traditional hand lathing techniques for excellent quality
Ideal for tonal riding or heavy crashing, with a lively sounding bell that is very responsive
cons: Some players find it too dull for certain music genres

customer_reviews.title: an inexpensive cymbal that makes noise and is fun to hit on when messing around in my basement
customer_reviews.text: it is what it is...an inexpensive cymbal that makes noise and is fun to hit on when messing around in my basement. it has no special tone, sounds tinny, but makes a cymbal noise - I cannot fault it for not being a professional quality instrument due to the price. the brass is thick and will hold up well with a student. no real sustained tone. no brightness. simply not for a professional nor someone who plays with any kind of group - good for a practice set and for someone like myself who just likes to bang around a drum set every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Alsing

customer_reviews.title: Sabian is amazing
customer_reviews.text: You cannot get better cymbals for the price than the Sabian B8 / SBR series. Period. They are tough, they have a nice tone and they are priced right. As a natural enemy and killer of cymbals, I will tell you flat out these are giving me a challenge!
customer_reviews.author: Techtesting

customer_reviews.title: I generally like Sabian cymbals and have played plenty of them over ...
customer_reviews.text: I generally like Sabian cymbals and have played plenty of them over the last 20 or so years. At $65 I didn’t expect too much out of the sound (though it wasn’t bad for an inexpensive cymbal). I did however expect it to last more that the three or so months until it cracked in two places. Obviously this isn’t a cymbal for gigs or recording, but apparently it isn’t even worth the coin for practice a few times a week either. My advice, stay away from this dud and spend a little more scratch on something that will last a little longer in the rehearsal room.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Ugh uninspiring sound
customer_reviews.text: You will get tired of this piece very quickly, it only helps Sabian in making their more expensive cymbals sound better.
customer_reviews.author: peederj

customer_reviews.title: Great ride
customer_reviews.text: This symbol makes a great ride and a great addition to my drum set. As a sabian product the quality is very good. Good thick brass. Symbol looks good. The price here was better than any eBay auction At the time I was looking. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Awesome crash - so-so ride.
customer_reviews.text: This cymbal, in my opinion, makes a great crash, which is what I use it for. It just isn't big enough to be a good ride, which is why I gave It three stars. If you are looking for a great, loud, ringy crash; this is your cymbal.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: What I like about it is the sound not too bright not too dull just right and I love the rugged Construction very well-made symbol will last anybody that uses a very long time
customer_reviews.author: brian michaels

customer_reviews.title: Not a studio drummer
customer_reviews.text: That sound great, and stay clean even in an old basement, but seriously they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: John Michael Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: product was delivered in a timely manner and is exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound as a ride and does double duty well as a crash....
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. He loves it because it can be used as a ride and a crash. Perfect for gigging!
customer_reviews.author: Dann Marr

customer_reviews.title: Great Ride for the Money
customer_reviews.text: The whole Sabian Line is just fantastic .. You couldnt ask more from a good cymbal like this.. The Price is low and the performance is high..
customer_reviews.author: Jay Micale "Hawk" Professional Pool Player & Instructor for Daytonajay Billiards LLC, Retired ASE Master Auto Technician

customer_reviews.title: wonderful sound just as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we were expecting, just like the cymbal at school. Great sound, way way better than the one that came with the drum set we had purchased.
customer_reviews.author: SHIRLEY SQUIRRLEY

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, sounds good
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, sounds good, very happy with it, could have been a bit thinner/lighter for crash use but still a great item, very happy...
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: REALLY flat sound but you get what you pay for

customer_reviews.title: Sabian. ROCKS THE  HOUSE
customer_reviews.text: Nice sounds from this new Cymbal every where you hit it it makes grovy sound from Spaz the Drummer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love Sabian so all I can say is Perfect. Fast shipping perfect packaging.

customer_reviews.title: Not that good.
customer_reviews.text: Considering most cymbals cost at least 3x as much as this one, it's what you'd expect. Not that good.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound by leaps and bounds over the basic cymbal ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound by leaps and bounds over the basic cymbal that can with the 5 piece Meridian Drum kit. Such a GREAT improvement. Sabian is quality.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it arrived sooner then expected and got the sound I was looking for to go with rest of my cymbals thanks again

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great cymbal for the price. Good tone, sustain, and durability.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: medioqure quality
customer_reviews.text: descent sound to dampend not rich enough and quality just isnt their.Good cymbal for beginer and something to jam with, not for professional usage.

customer_reviews.title: Great for this price range
customer_reviews.text: Good cymbal for beginners or those on tight budget. The bell in this crash/ride sounds better than the bell on the 20 inch SBR ride.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Wrong cymbal
customer_reviews.text: The price was great, shipping was decent, but i got the wrong cymbal. It wasn't even sabian. It was a stagg cx 18 inch crash/ride. At least it was the same sorta thing, but i would have liked to have gotten what i ordered. I am going to keep it, because it's to much of a hastle to send it back and stuff... It doesn't sound too bad, but the wrong one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Carey

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing cymbal, I just got it for my birthday. Ride tends to build up after a while, and you have to choke it, and crashes take considerable force, but it's an all around amazing sound.
customer_reviews.author: Dav King

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Crash-Ride
customer_reviews.text: Great, Bright crash sound. Bell, and ride are both amazing features, i use it mainly for a second crash, and it work perfectly with the rest of the SBR series. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ForTrav516

product_meta.title: Sabian SBR1811 SBR Series Pure Brass 18-Inch Crash/Ride Cymbal
product_meta.description:
A CLASSIC DUAL PURPOSE CYMBAL AT A SMART PRICE!
Delivering both a full-sounding ride and a penetrating, heavy crash, the SABIAN 18” SBr Crash Ride offers unmatched versatility at a price point that is sure to fit any budget. If this is your first kit, the SBr 18” Crash Ride offers the tonally tight sounds only SABIAN Brass can deliver. It’s the ideal first step for drummers looking to get into their first set of quality cymbals at a great value. With a wide range of models to choose from, SBr is easy to get into. We believe that it's not a question of where you finish − it's where you start. And with SBr, you're on the perfect track to get to where you want to go.

18" SBr Crash Ride offers unmatched versatility at a price point that is sure to fit any budgetView larger Features hand-guided, high-pressure hammering and traditional hand lathing for quality.View larger WHERE YOU BEGIN MATTERS
Let’s face it – at this price point, most manufacturers refuse to put their logo on the starter cymbals they manufacture. But the medium weight and classic profile of this popular model, along with the Sabian logo, lend it instant credibility. And it looks the part too, with deep, large-peen hammering and pinpoint lathing – the same hand-guided, high-pressure hammering and hand lathing that Sabian lavishes on its expensive bronze cymbals. As a result, the decay is fast so you can crash-ride it with confidence, and the bell has a powerful sound – not unlike a much more expensive bronze bell. Stick response is clean and the sound is always lively.

SABIAN SBR – THE BEST BRASS!
Where you begin as a drummer is important. For that reason, SABIAN has designed SBr cymbals to make your first steps easy and enjoyable. Hammered and lathed, SBr cymbals deliver the tightly focused sounds of pure brass – at a very nice price. And they are available in popular models and sizes. Responding to a universal demand for quality cymbals at all price points, SABIAN introduced SBr in 2009 as a new series of brass cymbals designed to offer improved quality and value for entry level drummers. Produced from a special-formula brass alloy in the SABIAN Vault, the budget-priced SBr is available in a full range of popular sizes and models, each featuring deep, large-peen hammering and pinpoint lathing.

CRAFTED IN THE SABIAN VAULT
SABIAN Master Product Specialist Mark Love was instrumental in the launch of the popular Brass series: “SBr offers a new, higher quality of brass cymbal and sound for beginner drummers and students. Despite their budget price, SBr cymbals are designed as value-added cymbals that set a new standard of quality at this price point. To guarantee this level of quality, SBr cymbals feature the same hand-guided, high-pressure hammering and traditional hand lathing applied to more expensive professional cymbals. ”

SONICALLY MATCHED – ONLY FROM SABIAN
When you get into drumming, it’s not a question of where you’ll finish – it’s where you start. With SBr, you can be confident your sound is powered by pure SABIAN brass. And you’ll sound even better when you choose a “Sonically Matched” set containing cymbals hand-selected by the experts in the SABIAN Vault. The SABIAN 18” SBr Crash Ride is available in the SBr 2-Pack along with 14” SBr Hats. It’s just one more example of SABIAN’s dedication to players seeking affordable quality in their first cymbal purchases.

Deep, large-peen hammering & pinpoint lathing give this SBr a look and sound well beyond its price. 

PRODUCT FEATURES
 * An effective dual-purpose cymbal for discerning beginners 
 * Designed and crafted in the SABIAN Vault 
 * Ideal for full-sounding riding or heavy crashing 
 * Clean stick response, with lively bell 
 * Professional large peen hammering and pinpoint lathing 
 * SABIAN Brass delivers tightly-focused sound 
 * Smartly and affordably priced for any budget 
 * Where you begin matters – Play the best brass! 
 * Quality protected by SABIAN 1-Year Warranty
feature_bullets: Delivers full-bodied riding and loud crashing equally well
Smartly priced, SBr Brass is in a class of its own
SBr makes your first step into cymbals an easy one
